title: An Easy Guide to Making Your Own Origami Envelopes

steps.title: Take a square piece of paper
steps.content: Take a square piece of paper with the corner facing you. You can find a range of origami paper on Amazon . If you want a colored envelope, make sure the colored side is facing down. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the paper in half,
steps.content: Fold the paper in half, from corner to corner across the square.

steps.title: Take the top corner of the first layer
steps.content: Take the top corner of the first layer and fold it down to the bottom edge. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the right corner
steps.content: Fold the right corner one third over to the left. You do not have to be exact, just try to be as accurate as possible.

steps.title: Take the left corner
steps.content: Take the left corner and fold it over to the other end. Now the bottom portion should be square shaped.

steps.title: Fold the point of the flap over the other flap
steps.content: Fold the point of the flap over the other flap back to the left edge of the model.

steps.title: Fold the point of the flap up
steps.content: Fold the point of the flap up to the top corner of the flap. Unfold. This is a crease to help guide the next step. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Turn the model 180 degrees.
steps.content: Turn the model 180 degrees. The point of view in the photo will now change.

steps.title: Open the folded portion of the flap.
steps.content: Open the folded portion of the flap.

steps.title: Make a squash fold
steps.content: Make a squash fold on this flap. Make sure you flatten it well, as this will help secure the envelope closed. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Change the position back so it is "upright."
steps.content: Change the position back so it is "upright." Or turn it back 180 degrees.

steps.title: Fold the very top point
steps.content: Fold the very top point down to the bottom edge. Or, the bottom edge of the square you formed by "squashing."

steps.title: Put the top flap (the portion you just folded down)
steps.content: Put the top flap (the portion you just folded down) into the "pocket" that was formed by the squash fold. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Flatten the model.
steps.content: Flatten the model. Ensure that the model can hold itself together.If you want , you can decorate with stickers or small drawings ...

steps.title: Take a plain piece of printer paper and write or type your message.
steps.content: Take a plain piece of printer paper and write or type your message. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Fold it in half hamburger style so it looks like this.
steps.content: Fold it in half hamburger style so it looks like this. Make sure the message is on the inside.

steps.title: Unfold the piece of paper.
steps.content: Unfold the piece of paper.

steps.title: With the writing facing you, take one side of the paper, and fold it at a right angle so that the edge is touching the first crease.
steps.content: With the writing facing you, take one side of the paper, and fold it at a right angle so that the edge is touching the first crease.

steps.title: Do this with the other side.
steps.content: Do this with the other side.

steps.title: On one side of each right triangle, there is an open space.
steps.content: On one side of each right triangle, there is an open space. With one side, fold that space over so that it is touching the right triangle.

steps.title: Do this with the other side.
steps.content: Do this with the other side.

steps.title: Then take one side and fold it over at a right angle against the first crease.
steps.content: Then take one side and fold it over at a right angle against the first crease.

steps.title: Do this with the other side so it looks like this.
steps.content: Do this with the other side so it looks like this.

steps.title: Then take one of these last triangles.
steps.content: Then take one of these last triangles. You'll see a small flap under the tip of it. Slide the tip of it underneath the little flap.

steps.title: Slide the tip of the other triangle underneath the flap found under it.
steps.content: Slide the tip of the other triangle underneath the flap found under it. Now it's done. It should look like this.

steps.title: If you plan on mailing the envelope, you can write the address on the back.If you want , you can decorate with stickers or small drawings...
